Medicaid covers nearly 24% of rural Americans, 45% of rural children and 15% of rural seniors. The uninsured rate in rural areas in states that expanded Medicaid under the ACA has dropped by a median of 44% since expansion.

But Republicans want to gut Medicaid... makes sense.
Rural hospital closures are more common in states that did not expand Medicaid, so it is vital that we protect the ACA and Medicaid expansion to keep our rural communities healthy.
Rural hospitals bring health care and jobs to rural Americans. They are often the largest employers in a community, keeping our rural communities healthy and rural Americans employed.

The ACA and its Medicaid expansion have been crucial in addressing the unique barriers to accessing health care in rural communities. By backing this obscene lawsuit, the President and Republican politicians in Washington are betraying rural communities. #ProtectOurCare

Former National Security Advisor John Bolton has been noted as the “highest-ranking voice of dissent” within the Trump Administration related to Ukraine. One witness indicated that Bolton equated the Trump Administration’s actions related to Ukraine as a “drug deal.”

Vindman & Hill’s testimony reported that Mulvaney authorized Sondland to communicate a quid pro quo to Ukraine involving a White House meeting. America needs to hear about that agreement and Mulvaney’s role in the delay in releasing nearly $400 million in military aid to Ukraine.

Acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney, the highest-ranking official to be directly implicated in the quid pro quos, is said to have conditioned a meeting between Trump and Ukrainian President Zelensky on investigations into Hunter Biden.

In any trial, jurors need to hear from witnesses and see the evidence in order to make the best possible verdict.

In Pennsylvania alone, according to @ProtectOurCare nearly 5.3 million Pennsylvanians have a pre-existing condition, including 643,000 children. If the President has his way, the protections they gained under the ACA would be ripped away.

If the ACA is overturned, protections END for the 130 million people with a pre-existing condition. This includes roughly half of nonelderly Americans, 17 million children, 68 million women and 30 million people aged 55-64. The uninsured rate will increase by 65 percent.

President Trump and Republican politicians are using the Department of Justice to advance a partisan and obscene lawsuit that would end ACA protections for pre-existing conditions and rip health care away from millions of Americans.

President Trump and Republican politicians allowed short-term junk health insurance plans – which don’t have to cover pre-existing conditions – to flourish by continuously working to sabotage the health insurance market and roll back critical consumer protections.
